storyInfo: Rumors about the treatment of the Exemplars spreads amongst the rank and file. No one wants Parliament to disband the unit, with their heroic accomplishments. Lieutenant Shearer continues to be plagued by the injuries he suffered during the war.

attributes.content: <p=1>Ten Pints Pub</><p=2>December 21st, 1098, 5:05 P.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: Good job, Madam Speaker, I say!
attributes.name: Drunken Soldier

attributes.content: Rip up every tile in Londinium and root out the devil scum hiding under them! *cough* *cough*...
attributes.name: Drunken Soldier

attributes.content: I hear there's gonna be a big shipment of Oripathy meds coming in.
attributes.name: Ragged Citizen

attributes.content: I got a friend at the procurement office. Maybe he can get me some meds first, and I'll see if I can get some for you, hah... cheers— *hic* —
attributes.name: Ragged Citizen

attributes.content: You were strutting all day when you got into the duke's army... and then you went to the Exemplars, and now here you are after the end of the war, just like me.
attributes.name: Ragged Citizen

attributes.content: Two Infected with nothing left—
attributes.name: Ragged Citizen

attributes.content: Who are you calling Infected?!
attributes.name: Drunken Soldier

attributes.content: I can fight! I'm not like you! I'm not afraid to die... *vomit*—
attributes.name: Drunken Soldier

attributes.content: The other patrons look up at the staggering soldier.
A coin flies across his face and lands on the bar counter. A haggard figure grabs him by the shoulder.
He's drunk. Take him home. I've got the bill.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Don't mind what they said, madam.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: He's just telling the truth, Lieutenant.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: I'm retired too. But suit yourself.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Sure. As for your question... it doesn't matter if I was talking to the one whose name's on the warrant, or Reunion, or anybody else.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: The workers want to do something for our home. I can't just stand by and watch everything get worse.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Extraordinary times call for extraordinary measures. That's how things have always been for us.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Just friendly advice. I've seen what medicine from dubious sources can do. I watched a soldier collapse into his drink a couple of days ago.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: I'd performed emergency surgery on him during the war.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: That time, he survived. But this time... it was the last checkup he ever got.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: You're a kind soul.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: The apothecary in my neighborhood says he can't remember how many came to him for poison during the war.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: I don't remember everyone I've ever treated, of course.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: I've seen much worse in my time as field medic, but at least I get to see those who walk out the field hospital again.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Spend enough time drinking here, and you begin to recognize the faces in the crowd that you've seen before, even if it was only once.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: I know some doctors, the Rhodes Islanders. Maybe you need their help.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: You forget that I'm a physician myself... what do you think of the Exemplars?
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: It's asking a lot, getting an old burdenbeast to remember something that long ago.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: It's ancient history, even to me. All I remember is that decades ago, when kids would brag about this and that, they wouldn't be tossing around the names of dukes, it was the Exemplars.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: There were lots of heroes. Lots of them lost.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: No, what I mean is—
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: I know what you wanted to hear, but I don't have anything else for you. Sorry.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Most people in the new 'Exemplars' aren't soldiers. You can't compare them to the old ones.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: We didn't start celebrating here in the city when the dukes defeated the Sarkaz, that's the end of it.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: The walls were on fire, and unarmed Londiniers trapped inside with the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Nobody knew if the dukes would spend the next two months talking before they entered the city. Nobody knew what would become of us.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: It was the Exemplars who came. No one can take away what you did, not in Londinium, at least.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Catherine pauses. She notices the officer's hand trembling in the dim light of the tavern.
He reaches into his pouch, trying to find something, but finally sighs and takes a big swig from his mug.
These days, the only contribution most of us make is to the business of the city's drinking establishments.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Thankfully, the kindly owner here doesn't throw out loitering drunkards.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: After all, most of those who fought tooth and nail to get back home no longer have homes at all.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: To hard-won victory.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Shearer raises his mug, but Catherine does not do the same.
I'm afraid you found the wrong drinking partner. I have an appointment to keep, and I intend to be sober for it.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: You're drunk, medic. Leave the alcohol to your later days.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: I've heard the rumors about the Exemplars. Why don't you talk to the Speaker directly?
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Catherine gets up, goes around the other patrons, nods at the owner behind the counter, and disappears behind a door in the corner obscured by boxes.
...What makes you think I haven't?
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: He looks in the direction where Catherine went. It leads to a forgotten corner of the city.
The Defense Force patrols went in many times, but never found anything.
None of my business.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: He waves the proprietor over for another drink.
Lieutenant Shearer sent two messages. I asked the Messenger and both came from this underground pub.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: But Delphine said she made arrangements for all the surviving soldiers of Duke Windermere's ship.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Are you sure we don't want to check out the street that Delphine talked about first?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: No. Let's go in.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.text: I followed behind Vina and let her open the door, because I was still used to kicking them in.
\nThe Glasgow Gang never, ever, caused trouble in Auchterigg Borough.
Vina said we were just getting a drink with some old Exemplar friends, but I knew there was a lot on her mind.
\nShe had made arrangements to stop some factories and ration the refined Originium reserves for the winter.
\nBut the word 'Exemplars' was always there at the bottom of her memo—our old friends.

attributes.content: Deal. You're gonna answer my questions frankly and truthfully, right?
attributes.name: Excited Soldier

attributes.content: As long as you beat me at arm wrestling.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Brr—
attributes.name: Excited Soldier

attributes.content: Piece of cake.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Hmph, I figured my injury wouldn't be a problem...
attributes.name: Excited Soldier

attributes.content: I know what you want to ask.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: 'Will she disband the Exemplars?'
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Honestly, I don't know. The stuff she's thinking about has been getting more and more complicated, and I've given up trying to figure it out.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: My guess is no. She even came to see us in the clothes that she wore when we fought together. If that's not sending a message, I don't know what it is.
attributes.name: Excited Soldier

attributes.content: Didn't she say she just didn't want to draw too much attention?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: That's what's in all the books! You wouldn't get it.
attributes.name: Excited Soldier

attributes.content: What you see here is no exception.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Many Exemplars are suffering from their lingering war wounds.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: With medicine in short supply, alcohol represents one of the few sources of comfort available to them.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: While some are here for information, most are here all day and night because they simply have nowhere else to go.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Is this why you wrote to me? To stand up for them?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: No... I see you have not read my letter.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: I'm sorry, there's been so much going on—
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: You used to be more straight and forthcoming, Madam Speaker.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: If you think the Exemplars are calling for you to pay more attention to veterans' welfare, I can tell you that you're wrong.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: They're waiting for your next order.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Everyone I've talked to for the past two months believes that Siege has grown since becoming Speaker, that she's getting even better as a leader.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: And the question they ask the most is—where do we go next?
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Are you telling me to continue to send them to bleed and die, instead of trying to make life better for them?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: You never truly saw yourself as their leader. You saw them as equals, as comrades in arms. I respect you for that, but it's also where you have failed in your responsibilities.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Forgive my frankness, but for many of them, what's left of their lives will never know a greater happiness than the taste of victory they enjoyed as the Exemplars.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: He grabs his mug and tries to take a swig.
But it slips from his hands and falls to the ground.
The others look towards Shearer, whose eyes are red as he takes deep breaths, trying to keep himself under control.
He takes out a coin, puts it on the table, and raises his hand at the proprietor without looking at him. On his part, the proprietor simply goes about cleaning up the mess without batting an eyelid.
One more of the same, please.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Where were we, Madam Speaker?
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.text: I never got along well with Lieutenant Shearer. For a long time, Vina's fist knocking him dizzy had cemented my impression of him.
\nA field medic. Stubborn, but largely calm and dependable.
\nHis surgeon's hands brought many back from the brink of death.

attributes.content: You... why—
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Lingering effect of an injury.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: It was one hell of a battle, wasn't it?
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.text: It wasn't his hand that was injured. I remember it well.
\nHe sat straight and tall. I thought he had recovered with Delphine's help.
\nAs he said, though, it was one hell of a battle we fought to return to Londinium.

attributes.content: <p=1>At the City Walls</><p=2>September 25th, 1098, 3:03 A.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: Any news about the situation in the city?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Unclear.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: As of yesterday, the Military Commission still had a heavy presence in important areas.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: With the Royal Court elites deployed around the walls in a standoff with the dukes, however, the resistance within the city stands a better chance.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The siege's gone on ten days already! When are the dukes gonna charge?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: If the priority is to minimize casualties amongst the allied forces, then besieging the city is the best way, particularly with the Duke of Wellington's position still uncertain...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: But they're playing with the lives of innocent citizens! If this drags on much longer...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Are they really okay with taking over an empty city?
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: If the truth about the situation here gets out—
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Nothing gets out. They will not allow anything to happen out of their control.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: People often underestimate the dukes, but the truth is, they have never changed.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Just like how they treated the Steam Knights.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: It's only one example... I can't say I know all of them well, but I knew my own mother.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Ethics is the first thing to go out the window when dealing with matters of shared interest.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The focus had already shifted to how to retrieve The Shard tech at the joint staff meeting last night.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: So they've already accepted this outcome.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Dagda...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I need a squad, Siege. I'm going to try that Confessarius passage that Shining shared with us again—
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: I'll be back, Vina. I promise.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Go.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: You're just gonna let her go like that?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: I'm keeping an eye on you, Dagda. Now's not the time to play the hero!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Well, you'd better not fall behind then, Hannah.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Delphine, any updates from Feist and Rockrock?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: They've reached the backup access port from when the wall was first built, but they can't find an opportunity to get close with all the Sarkaz patrols.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The Doctor's team is trying to give us an opening. One feint attack is all that it takes to create an opening, but...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The alliance doesn't plan to attack at all.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Correct.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Delphine, can you guarantee that you'll find a way inside, if there's a gap in the Sarkaz lines?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Yes, but I need help. We can try to persuade the dukes again—
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Vina shakes her head.
Give me two hours.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I'll pull a squad with decent Arts skills and some battle drones. We'll feign an attack on the access port at N12 to draw their attention—
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: You take the rest of them.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: No! You'll be going to your death!
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Chetleigh, Brentwood, the Gloriana, Silverrock Bluffs... we were going to our deaths, each and every time.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: But somebody has to do it. I'm with you, Vina.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: There is no answer from Vina. Morgan notices a strange look on her face.
...Vina?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Urgent message from the Doctor—
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Loughshinny just went into the Wellington encampment.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: ...Who's Loughshinny?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.text: There were many things on the battlefield that I didn't understand. Calm and storm, victory and defeat, everything happened so fast.
\nAfter the alliance had besieged the city for ten days, the Gastrell, which had long departed the ducal alliance camp, suddenly moved into the heart of the allied position.
For the first time in a very long while, those who were listening to the alliance comms channel heard the voice of the old duke—
\n'The Gastrell shall restore the Empire's glory.'
Broadsides fired straight at our city walls.

attributes.content: <p=1>At the City Walls</><p=2>September 25th, 1098, 7:33 A.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: Tell the people behind us, no delay through the trenches!
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: The bulk of the Sarkaz forces are being tied up at the front, but that doesn't mean we have all day.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Sir, there's a lot of equipment in the camp that we need time to—
attributes.name: Exemplar Nurse

attributes.content: There is no time!
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: We can deal with the equipment issue once we get into the city.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Some of the wounded can't walk on their own. We'll need to carry them by stretcher.
attributes.name: Exemplar Nurse

attributes.content: You follow the path that Siege has cleared for us. I'll organize the transfer of the wounded. Now go!
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: I'll help, sir. I'm more familiar with the situation of individual patients.
attributes.name: Exemplar Nurse

attributes.content: Plus, I promised them I wouldn't leave them behind.
attributes.name: Exemplar Nurse

attributes.content: Grab your own share of suppressant and protective gear from the patients' supplies. Better than nothing, at least.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: The closer we get to the walls, the higher the atmospheric Originium particle density. The wounded will be in more danger than us.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Yes, sir.
attributes.name: Exemplar Nurse

attributes.content: They say you're not a Londinier, sir. Why would you risk your neck like this?
attributes.name: Exemplar Nurse

attributes.content: Look! Another battleship is giving covering fire for the Gastrell!
attributes.name: Exemplar Nurse

attributes.content: The Duke of Caster...
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Weren't they saying that the Duke of Wellington betrayed us and fell out with the Duke of Caster?
attributes.name: Exemplar Nurse

attributes.content: Shit!
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Contact his liege, we have sighted a small force of Victorians. Request permission to engage.
Get them. Leave survivors. Find out what their unit's objective is.
attributes.name: Nachzehrer Royal Court Elites

attributes.content: What happened to the clouds?
attributes.name: Nachzehrer Royal Court Elites

attributes.content: ...Fire.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: The sky lights up with the fire on the city walls.
The first wave of purple flame came from the bow of the Gastrell, gushing towards the walls of Londinium. And again. And again.
Like the cold waves of death that splashed against the sheer cliffs of Iberia.
It fell upon the Nachzehrers before Shearer, burning away the rot.
Londinium's walls are alight, ignited by Draco fire.
The Sarkaz defenders became kindling for the purple inferno.
Th—They're dead?
attributes.name: Exemplar Nurse

attributes.content: Careful. The fire has cleared a path, but it's a threat to us too.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Hah.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: In the distance, he sees the figure on the withered throne fade in and out of the purple flames, gunfire from the ships roaring beside it.
On the walls, death ignites death.
Beneath the walls, the living walk amongst the ashes of the dead.
This is a war that will shock all the Core nations.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: It is not the number of casualties that will interest them the most... but how many people on both sides are actually fighting for the city of Londinium itself.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: It's a long way home for you.
attributes.name: Shearer
